Container.Name: PlexWatch
Container.Overview: PlexWatch is a Discord bot that brings your Plex media server to life with a real-time dashboard. Monitor active streams, track SABnzbd downloads, and check server uptimeâ€”all directly in your Discord server.
Container.ExtraSearchTerms: automation bot discord plex monitoring server sabnzbd
Container.Requires: Bot is configured via `config.json` file in App Data path. See documentation: https://github.com/nichtlegacy/PlexWatch?tab=readme-ov-file#configuration

Config.Name: Discord - Authorized User IDs
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of Discord user IDs authorized to admin the bot

Config.Name: Discord - Channel ID
Config.Description: Discord channel ID to send messages to

Config.Name: Plex - Server URL
Config.Description: URL of your Plex server (e.g., http://plex-server:32400)

Config.Name: SABnzbd - URL
Config.Description: Optional, SABnzbd URL (e.g., http://sabnzbd:8080) for integration

Config.Name: SABnzbd - API Key
Config.Description: Optional, SABnzbd API key for integration

Config.Name: Uptime Kuma - URL
Config.Description: Optional, Uptime Kuma URL (e.g., http://uptime-kuma:3001) for integration

Config.Name: Uptime Kuma - Username
Config.Description: Optional, Uptime Kuma username for authentication

Config.Name: Uptime Kuma - Password
Config.Description: Optional, Uptime Kuma password for authentication

Config.Name: Uptime Kuma - Monitor ID
Config.Description: Optional, Uptime Kuma monitor ID for integration

Config.Name: Running In Docker
Config.Description: Required for Docker running, do not change.
